name: Tengmalm’s Owl
spread_note: Circumpolar taiga and boreal forests of Eurasia and North America, with isolated populations in mountain forests further south
proportions: Body length 13–15.5 cm, tail length 9–10.5 cm, wingspan 48–55 cm, weight 100–160 g
attractions: When hunting, it relies primarily on its excellent hearing, detecting prey under snow or in dense vegetation. Perched on a branch, it listens for rustling before swooping down silently. It nests in tree cavities.
